main_definition: Master of Business Administration is a postgraduate degree in business administration or management offered by many universities worldwide.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A prestigious degree earned after completing an MBA program.
meanings_and_examples.example: She just graduated with her MBA from Harvard, one of the most renowned business schools.
Having an MBA often means having a deep understanding and expertise in various aspects of running a business.

meanings_and_examples.definition: MBA as a professional development course for working individuals seeking to advance their careers.
meanings_and_examples.example: He decided to enroll in the part-time MBA program at his local university to improve his management skills while continuing work.
